headline: Does Stanley Black & Decker’s (SWK) New Britain Exit Hint At A Deeper Shift In Its Tool Strategy?
summary: In late February 2026, Stanley Black & Decker said it would close its last New Britain, Connecticut manufacturing plant, cutting roughly 300 jobs as demand for single-sided tape measures declines and these products become increasingly obsolete versus electronic measuring tools. The decision ends more than 180 years of manufacturing in New Britain and highlights how rapidly digital measurement technologies are reshaping traditional hand tool categories. We’ll now examine how closing the New...
